etymology.description: Pictogram: a stylized picture of clouds; later borrowed for “to say”. Original cloud sense distinguished as 雲 = semantic 雨 (“rain”) + phonetic 云.
etymology.interpretation: Initially a drawing of drifting clouds, the graph was later reused to write a near-homophone meaning “to say.” To separate the weather sense, scribes added the “rain” element to form 雲; modern simplified script reverted to the older form for “cloud.”
etymology.simplification: PRC simplification dropped the added semantic 雨 from 雲, returning to the older pictographic form 云 and unifying the shapes used for “cloud” and the loan sense “to say.”

examples.chinese: 天上有很多云(天上有很多雲)。
examples.english: There are many clouds in the sky.

examples.chinese: 乌云遮住了太阳(烏雲遮住了太陽)。
今天多云转晴(今天多雲轉晴)。
examples.english: Today it will be mostly cloudy, turning clear.
